comments.body: Hey it’s me again here with another new idea

if mojang will do it their equip will need to add 112 new blocks!!!

:/
What if when you click a raw ore on a block it goes in, then when you break that block you get the raw ore and the block back.
Iceologers?
Iceolomountanieers?
they need a better name.

Not true. It doesn't make any sense at all if they made a huge update like the holiday version of Caves & Cliffs a 1.17.x version. Anyway, they already confirmed in the FAQ that Phase 2 coming in the holiday will be called 1.18, which makes sense and is consistent with every other update that has been split (just look at the Adventure Update or the Update Aquatic on Bedrock Edition).

I personally think it's a mistake to split the two. Both updates should be delayed until it is complete as a whole. As of now the summer update is nothing more then a minor mod with so much of the big changes delayed. Just delay the entire update to holiday season. This is just going to turn modding into a huge mess.

396386292072 I had no idea that there were two updates that were divided before and were put into two different versions with a similar theme but in my opinion it would be better if they did not do this, I think it is better that they delay version 1.17 than the second phase of Cliffs & Caves Update is 1.18, it would be relatively irrelevant, I also agree with 385456005692 that it will be complicated for modders to have two versions of the same, so in my opinion it is better to leave a version like 1.17 for only the Cliffs & Caves Update and 1.18 for a different theme.
In my opinion, nothing changes: patience, the next real update will be called 1.19.
i don't want minecraft beta i want 1.17.02
Can you include a picture ?
Zombiefied Piglins too

I personally dissagree. Making zombies drop the ores would make less sense to the lore than letting them drop the ingots.Essentially, zombies currently have a chance to drop almost anything you can find commonly in a dungeon chest. They originally added this feature as a way to get an unexpected suprise while killing a low level monster. Like most people, I can can understand 1 iron, or crop to plant as a reward for that small of a task is a good early game reward. An iron block would be too large, and an iron ore drop would defeat the purpose of making the drop rate low as they would now have to work to smelt it as well. As for a reward for drops, ingots are perfect for the job. Less mob variants spawned in the nether when it was added, zombie pigmen being the most common, which is why they chose to do nuggets for them. They may not be as common as they were in the past, but they did add gold to the nether, so we really cant complain. The feature should stay the way it is as a small rewards system for new players.

This is pretty cool, I am just worried that the real challenges of gold tools are going to be taken away. The whole point of them being fast but really breakable is balance. Making a tool too overpowered will demolish the balance and the challenge.
That removes the tradeoff of Gold Though. Copper is MUCH too common for this to be balanced as well.
It’s just an iron pickaxe with efficiency, it’s just used to mine faster, not give any extra durability.
Very good idea!
This is a very good point and u have my vote
Or Deepslate + Basalt
This would be nice also for Calcite and Dripstone Block.
They could also add these variations to calcite, smooth basalt, and dripstone
That would be really cool!

This is an interesting idea, but maybe you're forgetting that you already get XP when you smelt the raw ore, so this would be double XP. If this were implemented, I'd expect smelting ores to no-longer give you XP so you don't get it twice.
You already get XP from smelting the raw minerals, so this might be too much.

I mean, part of the reason this update is underway is because people should have more reason to go mining. However, getting benefits for other uses, such as enchanting, is not necessarily the point. The point of the update is to make caving/mining more exciting. All the same, more people would want to go mining.
Isaac Annear, I agree with your point but how does it relate to this post?
I was thinking that the Warden could become overwhelmed if too many sounds were present at once. Like if it was given too many frequencies it would blindly attack around itself.

Why do people keep destroying the purpose and meaning of the Warden? I really want an explanation. Why does it need to have a weakness when it's meant to be avoided and fled from? How would that contribute to the gameplay? There are a lot of mobs without particular weaknesses, and even if there are not, the Warden is the perfect chance to have a mob without a weakness. What is the problem if there is a mob you can't possibly kill? Why are so many people skeptical of that? The reward of the Warden is not in killing it or fighting with it. The reward is what you get from the Deep Dark. The Warden creates very unique gameplay by being a mob you need to avoid and be extremely careful around instead of just spamming it with your attacks. It adds a lot of fear and strategy into the Deep Dark that doesn't really exist elsewhere in the game. If it has any weakness, then people will just start to take advantage of that and try to delibirately fight and kill it just to get the sense of achievement.
When will warden come and we r waiting as 1.18 does not have the warden so we have to wait for 1.19?
The Warden doesn't need a weakness it's made to be scary, strong and avoided in the deep dark depths
No
good idea! but it should also blind the player.
I'm gonna be honest, when I first read the title my brain pictured the zombie Husks instead of actual huskies! XD
Wandering traders should sell all the ore types, to make them renewable

Unique suggestion for increasing mining efficiency. Since it is so easy to build an iron farm if they refuse to remove them then in order to compete this should have multiple tiers like a beacon or conduit and have the forge be a multiblock structure. Perhaps with fuel going from charcoal to blaze powder to lava. And have it consume fuel much faster as a price for the increased yeild. Perhaps the max level should use 1 lava bucket to smelt 10 times. Something more reasonable as lava is now renewable
maybe it could be a redstone+glowstone+helmet generated at the workbench.
You could even use Amythyst crystals to make the light with glow-squid ink.
it could be made of copper

We are already getting archaeology sites which are basically buried ruins. Not only this, but the deep dark has many chests, which I presume will mean they contain many structures. Since there are already 1 or 2 ruin-like structures being added in the Caves and Cliffs update, I don't think this is needed.
I agree, lizards are super cool
Well technically we have the dragon ...

Man könnte Chamäleons ins Spiel einbringen die sich vor Blöcken tarnen können.

Die könnten ein Item tropen um beispiel die Rüstung zu tarnen das man alle paar Minuten für ca 20-30 Sekunden aktivieren könnte damit das nicht zu OP ist.

Oder wir fügen kleine süße Geckos hinzu um es zu versüßen.

Legoane wären auch ganz cool die bewegen dann den Kopf so nach vorn und hinten.

Schlanken die sich häuten können wäre auch ganz nice man könnte daraus wohlmöglich neue Leder Arten erschaffen.

I like grimstone a lot, but I agree that it's a bit too harsh and clashes too much with stone. As a base layer for the caves, it feels a bit too busy after you light everything up. I saw someone comment that its top and bottom texture should be smooth, seeing as it's sedimentary, and I'd love that!! I hope they find a better way to blend the transition between stone and grimstone.
hoqsnqbxNMJLNKBJ nm

I like the Dripstone-Grimstone biome idea. It could almost be like a darker coloration of dripstone. Maybe the Grimstone version of Dripstone could allow for lava to drip faster and water to drip slower; or maybe both could drip faster.

I like the idea.
I think that the grimstone should be used for the deep dark caves, so we no longer have a new block and the grimstone is darker
This would be 100X more useful for elytra flying
I only specified mining because that's how I personally spend much of my time.
great idea, maybe they could do something similar to how maps actually have a 3d model, and when hold the item could display the actual y-level on the empty space below the dial?
I came up with the same idea. We need an immersive tool for determining altitude, especially when ores started to generate at different levels in 1.18.

A cool visual for this tool could be some sort of texture when you are close to an important altitude like, for example, a golden dot if you are close to the optimal level of gold or a blue dot if you are close to lapis. This would be so could so we don't need to go online to see the map of ores all the time.
You áre a genius
I think a bundle is not that big to carry a fox. Better to make a sack which is different from bundle to catch and carry small mammals, to transport them easily to captivity. Now that's what I like
If the bundle can hold 64 meter wide cubes, it can hold a fox. That said, it should only work on baby animals, and should take up the entire bundle.
How about the ore only generates under ocean monuments/deep ocean biomes?
The ore generating in ocean caves would make the most sense

I think, similar to the blackstone patches, that the prismarine ore should generate in patches, in a specific biome.  There should be a new biome added to minecraft in the ocean, and there probably would be one if this weren't added as a hotfix.
I like the idea of new Golem types, but I don't think the devs will add them unless they do something the current Golems and pets do not do.
